question: In which one of the following nations the headquarters of Grameen Bank, a microfinance organisation, is located?
explanation: Grameen Bank is a microfinance organisation formed to provide small loans or micro-credit to poor people without any collateral security. Its headquarters is located in Dhaka, capital of Bangladesh. The founder of the bank is Muhammed Yunus, who was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2006 for his contribution towards the establishment of this bank.
